definitions.definition: A small river ; a large creek ; a body of moving water confined by banks.
A thin connected passing of a liquid through a lighter gas (e.g. air).
examples: He poured the milk in a thin stream from the jug to the glass.

definitions.definition: Current , the force of moving water.
Any steady flow or succession of material, such as water, air, radio signal or words.
examples: Her constant nagging was to him a stream of abuse.

definitions.definition: A particular path, channel, division, or way of proceeding.
examples: Haredi Judaism is a stream of Orthodox Judaism characterized by rejection of modern secular culture.

definitions.definition: A source or repository of data that can be read or written only sequentially.
examples: In the context of computer science, lexical analysis can be defined as the conversion of a stream of characters to a stream of meaningful tokens.

definitions.definition: Digital data (e.g. music or video ) delivered in a continuous manner to a client computer , intended for immediate consumption or playback .

subdefinitions.definition: An instance of streaming digital data.

definitions.definition: A division of a school year by perceived ability .
examples: All of the bright kids went into the A stream , but I was in the B stream .

definitions.definition: A train of thought or flow in a conversation or discussion.
examples: Not to switch streams , but we really need to focus on talking about the economy right now...

main_definition: A small river ; a large creek ; a body of moving water confined by banks.
secondary_definitions: ( sciences , umbrella term ) All moving waters.
A thin connected passing of a liquid through a lighter gas (e.g. air).
Current , the force of moving water.
Any steady flow or succession of material, such as water, air, radio signal or words.
( figurative ) A particular path, channel, division, or way of proceeding.
( computing ) A source or repository of data that can be read or written only sequentially.
Digital data (e.g. music or video ) delivered in a continuous manner to a client computer , intended for immediate consumption or playback .
( UK , education ) A division of a school year by perceived ability .
A train of thought or flow in a conversation or discussion.
